origin_of_ch_char_book: This bird is different from the symbol which describes bird in general (È≥•, È∏ü, niao, bird).,(Èõ¢, Á¶ª, li, leave) is composed of a bird (È≥•, È∏ü, niao, bird) and a snare (ÁΩë, wang, net) which can catch the bird. Birds are very perceptive so they fly away quickly even at the slightest hint of someone approaching. Therefore, this Chinese character evoloved to mean ‚Äúto depart‚Äù or ‚Äúto leave‚Äù.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The character is like a bird with a long tail, and the claws evolved into four points (Shen Pei). "Shuowen": "Bird, the general name of the long-tailed bird. Pictogram. The feet of a bird are like a dagger, and it follows a dagger. Any bird's genus is from the bird."

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the names of people and places, and are also used as the original meaning of birds, such as "Combination" 116: "Call for a live young bird", a live young bird is a live young bird. Bronze inscriptions are used as names of people and clan. " Bird " and "Èöπ" are both pictographs of birds in ancient characters, so they are common. In addition to bird characters, there are many other hieroglyphs related to birds in ancient characters. The difference in shape is mostly in the style of bird crown or tail, such as "ËàÑ", " yan ", " yuan ", "Ááï", etc . The word " bird " later became a general term for "birds" or "birds", as in "Shangbo Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 21: "The flag of the North is made of birds", which means that the flag of the North is made of birds. After the word " bird " was extended to "birds", many different birds were expressed in the form of " bird " plus phonetic characters. These words are in "Er Ya. There is a very detailed record in the chapter "Shi Niao".

The character " bird " in "Guangyun" is "Du Liaoqie", which belongs to the character "Duanmu". This character often has different levels in modern dialects. For example, " bird " in Cantonese has nasal initials niu5 and stop initials diu2. The pronunciation of nasal initials is commonly used at present, such as "Bi-wing bird", "Niaoyuhuaxiang" and other words are all pronounced this sound. The rule of pronunciation of stop sounds is reserved for swear words and is mostly used in spoken language. It belongs to an earlier level of pronunciation and has older characteristics. Refers to the male genitalia of humans and animals. Later generations will use the word "Â±å" to express. As early as in the seventy-one chapters of "Water Margin," there were "Zhaoan, Zhaoan, and very good birds." In the forty-four chapters, there was "Brother, look at me as a fool." "The Western Chamber" also contains "Hehe, the bird is here."
humanum_short_description_en: A bird-shaped character with a side view. The original meaning is bird. It is a typical pictographic character. It is commonly seen in Oracle and Bronze inscriptions.

Elaboration: The character is like a bird with a long tail, and the claws evolved into four points (Shen Pei). "Shuowen": "Bird, the general name of the long-tailed bird. Pictogram. The feet of a bird are like a dagger, and it follows a dagger. Any bird's genus is from the bird." The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the names of people and places, and are also used as the original meaning of birds, such as "Combination" 116: "Call for a live young bird", a live young bird is a live young bird. Bronze inscriptions are used as names of people and clan. " Bird" and " Èöπ" are both pictographs of birds in ancient characters, so they are common. In addition to bird characters, there are many other hieroglyphs related to birds in ancient characters. The difference in shape is mostly in the style of bird crown or tail, such as " ËàÑ", " yan", " yuan", " Ááï", etc . The word " bird" later became a general term for "birds" or "birds", as in "Shangbo Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 21: "The flag of the North is made of birds", which means that the flag of the North is made of birds. After the word " bird" was extended to "birds", many different birds were expressed in the form of " bird" plus phonetic characters. These words are in "Er Ya. There is a very detailed record in the chapter "Shi Niao". The character " bird" in "Guangyun" is "Du Liaoqie", which belongs to the character "Duanmu". This character often has different levels in modern dialects. For example, " bird" in Cantonese has nasal initials niu5 and stop initials diu2. The pronunciation of nasal initials is commonly used at present, such as "Bi-wing bird", "Niaoyuhuaxiang" and other words are all pronounced this sound. The rule of pronunciation of stop sounds is reserved for swear words and is mostly used in spoken language. It belongs to an earlier level of pronunciation and has older characteristics. Refers to the male genitalia of humans and animals. Later generations will use the word " Â±å" to express. As early as in the seventy-one chapters of "Water Margin," there were "Zhaoan, Zhaoan, and very good birds." In the forty-four chapters, there was "Brother, look at me as a fool." "The Western Chamber" also contains "Hehe, the bird is here."
